meanings.definition: The act of emerging or coming out into view.
meanings.sent1: The emersions of the sun from behind the clouds brought warmth to the land.
meanings.sent2: The emersions of the stars at night always mesmerize me.
meanings.sent3: The sudden emersions of squirrels from the bushes startled the picnic-goers.
meanings.sent4: Her talent for painting had an emersions that captivated all who saw her work.
meanings.sent5: The emersions of the colorful fish from the coral reef made the underwater world come alive.

meanings.definition: The process of becoming visible after being concealed.
meanings.sent1: The emersions of the moon from behind the clouds was a beautiful sight.
meanings.sent2: The emersions of truth can sometimes be unsettling but necessary.
meanings.sent3: The magician's emersions from the box left the audience in awe.
meanings.sent4: The emersions of the city skyline at sunset was like a painting in the sky.
meanings.sent5: The emersions of the rare flower after the rain delighted the botanists.

meanings.definition: The act of rising from or as if from immersion.
meanings.sent1: The emersions of the diver from the deep sea was graceful and smooth.
meanings.sent2: The emersions of the swimmer from the pool marked the end of the race.
meanings.sent3: The emersions of the toast from the toaster was perfectly timed.
meanings.sent4: The emersions of the hot air balloon into the sky was a breathtaking sight.
meanings.sent5: The emersions of the submarine from the water surface was a marvel of engineering.
